A new and comprehensive geologic map of Lassen Volcanic National Park allows land managers, first responders and engineers to better assess volcanic hazards in the park and its vicinity, and provides a framework for all future earth science research in the area.

What: Public presentation about the geology and volcanic eruption history of Lassen Volcanic National Park and unveiling of a new geologic map of the park.

When: Wednesday, August 17, 2011, 10:30 a.m. – 11:30 a.m. PDT

Where: Loomis Museum
Lassen Volcanic National Park, California

Map and Directions: Lassen Volcanic National Park directions.
Use the Manzanita Lake entrance at the NW end of the Park.

Who: Dr. Patrick Muffler, USGS Geologist Emeritus and map co-author
Dr. Margaret Mangan, USGS Volcano Observatory Scientist-in-Charge

USGS scientists and Park officials will be available for interviews immediately following the presentation.
